BiblioData.Title: Dispersion of nanoparticles in organic solvents
BiblioData.Abstract: The invention relates to a dispersion of nanoparticles in an organic solvent, comprising a) 5-75 wt% of nanoparticles having a mean average size between 1 and 100 nm. b) a solvent comprising a hydroxyl group and an ether group. c) a water content of less then 15wt%. d) a dispersant content of less then 0,1 wt%. The invention also relates to a method of making such a dispersion, by I. Making a mixture of an aqueous dispersion of particles having an average size between 1 and 100 nm, a solvent comprising a hydroxyl group and an ether group, which forms an azeotrope with water, and a grafting compound. II. Heating the mixture under stirring at a temperature between 20 and 150 DEG C. III. At least partially removing the solvent/water mixture. IV. Optionally adding more solvent. V. Repeating steps I and IV till the water content of the obtained dispersion is less then a desired value and the concentration solid is between 5 and 70 wt%.

Claims.P: 1. Dispersion of nanoparticles in an organic solvent, comprising
a) 5-75 wt% of nanoparticles having a mean average size between 1 and 100 nm
b) A solvent comprising a hydroxyl group and an ether group
c) A water content of less then 15wt%
d) A dispersant content of less then 0,1 wt%.
2. The dispersion according to claim 1, wherein the amount of dispersant is less then 0,005 wt%.
3. The dispersion according to anyone of claims 1-2, wherein the solvent is chosen from the group consisting of 1-methoxy-2-propanol, 2-methoxy-1-propanol, 3-methoxy-1-butanol and 2-methoxy-ethanol.

4. The dispersion according to anyone of claims 1-3, wherein the nanoparticles are selected from the group consisting of silica, alumina, zirconia, titanium oxide, zinc oxide, germanium oxide, indium oxide, tin oxide, indium- tin oxide (ITO), antimony oxide, antimony-tinoxide and cerium oxide.
5. the dispersion according to anyone of claims 1-4, wherein the nanoparticles comprise organic surface groups.
6. The dispersion according to anyone of claims 1-5, wherein the particles have been treated with grafting compounds having a hydrolysable silyl group.
7. The dispersion according to anyone of claims 1-6, wherein the particles have been treated with alkoxysilane compounds.

8. The dispersion according to claim 7, wherein the alkoxysilane is selected from the group consisting of methyltrimethoxysilane, methyltriethoxysilane, glycidoxypropyltrimethoxysilane, vinyltrimethoxysilane and methacryloxypropyltrimethoxysilane.
9. The dispersion according to anyone of claims 6-8, wherein the amount of grafting compounds added to the nanoparticles ranges between 2 and 40 wt% (relative to the weight of the nanoparticles).

10. The dispersion according to anyone of claims 1-9, wherein the composition comprises between 5 and 15 wt% ATO particles modified with 1 - 10 wt% 3-methacryloxypropyl trimethoxy silane (relative to particles).

11. The dispersion according to anyone of claims 1-9, wherein the composition comprises between 15 and 30 wt% ATO particles modified with 5-15 wt% 3-methacryloxypropyl trimethoxy silane (relative to particles).

12. The dispersion according to anyone of claims 1-9, wherein the composition comprises between 30 and 70 wt% ATO particles modified with 20-40 wt% 3-methacryloxypropyl trimethoxy silane (relative to particles).
13. Process for making the dispersion according to anyone of claims 1-12, comprising the steps of

I. Making a mixture of an aqueous dispersion of particles having an average size between 1 and 100 nm, a solvent comprising a hydroxyl group and an ether group, which forms an azeotrope with water, and a grafting compound
II. Heating the mixture under stirring at a temperature between 20 and 150 [deg.]C
III. At least partially removing the solvent/water mixture,
IV. Optionally adding more solvent comprising a solvent comprising a hydroxyl group and an ether group, which forms an azeotrope with water,
V. Repeating steps III and IV till the water content of the obtained dispersion is less then a desired value and the concentration solid is between 5 and 70 wt%.
14. Process according to claim 13, wherein the ratio of water to organic solvent in step I ranges between 0.1 and 10.
15. Process according to claim 13, wherein the ration of water to organic solvent in step I ranges between 0.3 and 4.
16. Coating composition comprising a dispersion according to anyone of claims 1-12.
17. The coating composition according to claim 16, wherein the composition comprises a curable component.
18. The coating composition according to claim 17, wherein the curable component is a UV curable component, and wherein the composition comprises a photoinitiator.
19. The coating composition according to claim 18, wherein the UV curable component is a compound having (meth)acrylate groups.
20. Use of the coating composition according to anyone of claims 16-19 for preparing a coating on a substrate.
21. Use according to claim 20, wherein the substrate is a triacetylcellulose film.
22. Coated film comprising a cured coating composition according to 17-19 on a substrate.
